question: Which country is set to register Himalayan pink salt as Geographical Indications (GI)?
explanation:
Pakistan has decided to register Himalayan pink salt as Geographical Indications (GI), to curb the unauthorised use of the products by other countries.
The rare salt is extracted from the Salt Range in Punjab which extends along the mountains of Pakistan and the north of the Jhelum River. Pakistan is fighting a case in the European Union against Indiaâ€™s move to register Basmati rice as GI.
